text: 1. Now with reference to the body. Ri k is speech, Sâman breath 2 . This Sâman (breath) rests on that Ri k (speech). Therefore the Sâman is sung as resting on the Ri k . Sâ is speech, ama is breath, and that makes Sâma.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 2. Ri k is the eye, Sâman the self 3 . This Sâman (shadow) rests on that Ri k (eye). Therefore the Sâman is sung as resting on the Ri k . Sâ is the eye, ama the self, and that makes Sâma.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 3. Ri k is the ear, Sâman the mind. This Sâman (mind) rests on that Ri k (ear). Therefore the Sâman is sung as resting on the Ri k . Sâ is the ear, ama the mind, and that makes Sâma.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 4. Ri k is the white light of the eye, Sâman the blue exceeding darkness. This Sâman (darkness) rests on the Ri k (brightness). Therefore the Sâman is sung as resting on the Ri k . Sâ is the white light of the eye, ama the blue exceeding darkness, and that makes Sâma.

text: 6. He is lord of the worlds beneath that (the self in the eye), and of all the wishes of men. Therefore all who sing to the vî n â (lyre), sing him, and from him also they obtain wealth.
